required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Central Neck Dissection in Stage N0 Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Central Neck Dissection in Stage N0 Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: The benefits of prophylactic central neck dissection (pCND) remain controversial in clinically node-negative (cN0) papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC). This study main goal is to investigate benefits of prophylactic central neck dissection in clinically node-negative papillary thyroid carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC) is the most common type of differentiated thyroid carcinoma. Recurrence rate is still high. The standard management is total thyroidectomy. regional lymph node metastasis is noted in recurrent cases. Some studies stated benefits of central neck dissection in orevention of recurrence and others said there is no benefits. so prophylactic central neck dissection (pCND) remain controversial in clinically node-negative (cN0) papillary thyroid carcinoma (PTC).

primary_outcome.measure: the incidence metastatic lymph node in patients with clinically node-negative thyroid carcinoma who underwent total thyroidectomy with central neck dissection
primary_outcome.description: numbers of positive histopathological lymph node biopsies postoperative

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with node negative papillary thyroid carcinoma

intervention.description: dissection of central cervical lymph node grope in low grade papillary thyroid cancer
intervention.arm_group_label: patients with node negative papillary thyroid carcinoma

study_pop.textblock: patients with papillary thyroid carcinoma with clinically negative lymph node who undergo total thyroidectomy and central neck dissetion in assiut university hospital, department of general surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with papillary thyroid cancer with clinically node negative.
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with clinical evidence of nodal metastases.
- patients with a previous history of thyroidectomy.
- patients with mixed-type papillary thyroid cancer.
